name: eporta
slogan: Powering interior design professionals, eporta has everything to deliver seamless projects
description:
Since 2014, eporta has disrupted the $700bn/year interior design industry, growing to become the leading B2B company powering interior design professionals around the world.

Powering interior design professionals, eporta has everything they need to deliver seamless design projects and grow their business. From Smart Sourcing™ the world’s largest FF&E library to Connected Scheduling™ that delivers projects on time and on budget, join the team enabling thousands of interior designers to power their projects for free with eporta.

eporta is also proud to have the backing of high profile and experienced investors who are helping with their mission. These include Robin Klein (Lastminute.com), Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma), Rohan Blacker (founder of sofa.com), Paul Hsiao (Canvas Ventures), and the founding team at Zoopla.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer (UI/UX)
jobs.description:
WE ARE:

A fast-growing start-up revolutionising the design industry, a market worth over $700bn annually. eporta is an online marketplace where architects, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting and accessories and purchase directly from suppliers.

We have users in over 80 countries, so our business is already truly global - and we will be expanding from our UK office into another European location, and then into the US. We have a number of high profile investors including a large US venture capital fund, Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica

YOU ARE:

Someone who’s passionate about what’s right for the user. You’re driven to design interfaces that are both functional and beautiful; you can break down complex ideas into elegant solutions - and, most importantly, clearly and confidently explain your thinking to the wider team. You’re self-motivated, enthusiastic, highly efficient and keen to develop within a growing team whilst helping to shape the future and direction of the eporta platform.

YOUR ROLE:

This is a unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business, involved and contributing to all stages of the product lifecycle from inception to delivery. You’ll work through design problems from beginning to end; translating research insights into ideas that become best-in-class products, features and workflows.

Reporting to the Head of Design, your UX/UI responsibilities will include:

- Engaging with internal & external users to conduct research and evaluate feedback
- Sketching and prototyping ideas to quickly assess viability
- Designing the fine-grained details of interactions
- Championing (and improving) our design systems, best practice and UI/UX toolkit
- Producing beautiful, detailed UI, visual & interaction design & animation specifications
- Acting as a senior team member, mentoring other designers as needed

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

- Experience of the entire end-to-end product development process
- Proven experience designing digital products and systems - not just websites
- Comfortable questioning and constructively critiquing designs
- Experience working with personas and journey maps
- A clear understanding of usability, accessibility and associated best practices
- Demonstrable expertise creating high-fidelity mockups of designs in Sketch
- Skilled in Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator and Keynote
- Demonstrable experience working alongside design, engineering and marketing teams

Bonus points for…

- Animation and illustration skills
- Mobile app design experience
- HTML/CSS experience

jobs.title: Procurement Project Manager
jobs.description:
WE ARE:

A fast-growing start-up revolutionising the design industry, a market worth over $700bn annually. eporta is an online marketplace where architects, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting and accessories and purchase directly from suppliers.We have users in over 80 countries, so our business is already truly global. We have a number of high profile investors including a large US venture capital fund, Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica.

eporta Procurement is the exclusive furniture consultancy and procurement service of the eporta platform, working with architects, interior designers and businesses to deliver exciting large-scale projects in all industry sectors across the globe. Our growing procurement team have over 30 years’ experience of successful hospitality, office and high-end residential project delivery.

We are small, dynamic and ruthlessly meritocratic, with experience drawn from a wide range of sectors. Our leadership team have deep experience in private equity, fashion, high tech, and of course digital & e-commerce. Company culture and team dynamics are hugely important to us - we listen to everyone’s opinion, make a decision, and move fast.

YOU ARE:

Someone who is self-motivated, able to start a project and see it through to the very end. You have meticulous attention to detail. You love building relationships and understand how to manage and grow them through every step of a project, even when the going gets tough. You are a shrewd negotiator with strong commercial understanding, and you don’t shy away from a difficult conversation. Your project management skills are second to none; you’re in your element working to tight deadlines under pressure, overcoming barriers and problem-solving along the way. You take pride in your work and get others excited about what you do, and you’re someone people want to work with because they can rely on you.

YOU ARE:

Someone who is self-motivated, able to start a project and see it through to the very end. You have meticulous attention to detail. You love building relationships and understand how to manage and grow them through every step of a project, even when the going gets tough. You are a shrewd negotiator with strong commercial understanding, and you don’t shy away from a difficult conversation. Your project management skills are second to none; you’re in your element working to tight deadlines under pressure, overcoming barriers and problem-solving along the way. You take pride in your work and get others excited about what you do, and you’re someone people want to work with because they can rely on you.

YOUR ROLE:

A unique opportunity to make a real impact in a critical function of a fast-growing business. You will own and run FF&E procurement projects from initial consultation through to full installation and be responsible for every element involved. You will have a portfolio of your own clients to manage and engage, always with an eye for new business openings. You will work closely with the Business Development Manager, supporting new business acquisition and ensuring that the team successfully close opportunities.

This is a unique opportunity to join an exceptionally well supported business and team at an early stage and shape how it grows - you will be part of something BIG. You will have responsibility and will make a real impact on the success of the company, with the ability to define and shape your career as our business grows.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

- Minimum of 3 years Procurement/Project Management/Account Management experience
- Excellent communication and relationship building skills - you will love meeting people
- Knowledge of the furniture industry
- Organised and systematic - you’re creative but you also know how to get things done
- FF&E sourcing and specification
- Space and logistics planning 


BONUS POINTS FOR:

- An eye for design with creative flair
- Experience in working on FF&E procurement projects with a strong portfolio of Hospitality, Commercial and/or Residential projects
- A project management qualification
- FF&E and design projects portfolio/examples

SALARY:

£30,000 - £35,000

jobs.title: Business development manager (Suppliers)
jobs.description:
We are:
The leading high-growth startup revolutionising the $700bn a year interior design industry. As an online marketplace, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting, accessories and purchase directly from suppliers. With users in over 85 countries, the business is truly global.

We have a number of high profile investors including Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com, and Achica. Having recently completed our Series A funding with a US-based investor (Canvas Ventures) we are building out the team for the next stage of the business.

You are:
Someone who’s driven by building new relationships. You’re a natural networker, able to make connections and build new relationships within the industry. You’re excited by new challenges and ambitious targets.

You are tenacious, a self-starter and a creative, 'out-of-the-box' thinker with an entrepreneurial spirit. You are constantly looking for new opportunities to interact with and convince decision makers to trust our product. Learning and developing is a key driver for you and you have a thirst to grow and progress. You thrive in a fast paced environment but are comfortable with medium to long term sales cycles and dealing with multiple stakeholders. 

Your role:
A unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high-performing team. Working alongside our Commercial Director and reporting into our Supplier Team Manager, you will be responsible for onboarding new supplier accounts. You'll be explaining our vision, demonstrating how a partnership with eporta can significantly increase their market reach via a new sales channel, thereby increasing sales with minimal effort on their part.

You’ll be:
Strategically prospecting established FF&E brands
Building relationships with decision makers
Communicating both face to face & over the phone with suppliers to convince them of the benefits of joining our platform
Regularly attending industry events such as tradeshows and networking events


Your skills & experience:
Innate ability to solution sell
Excellent, natural communicator with impactful presentation skills
Tenacious desire to exceed quota
Demonstrable experience identifying key stakeholders and converting prospects
2+ years experience in a business development role - with numbers to back up your success


Bonus points for…

Previous work high-performance teams
Previous work in the property or furniture sector
Passion for design
Bilingual in Italian, Spanish or Portuguese
Salary

Competitive base + commission


Please apply here : https://www.eporta.com/careers/supplier-business-development-manager/

jobs.title: Brand Sales & Operations Manager
jobs.description:
We are:

The leading high-growth startup revolutionising the $700bn a year interior design industry. As an online marketplace, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting, accessories and purchase directly from suppliers. With users in over 85 countries, the business is truly global.

We have a number of high profile investors including Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com, and Achica. Having recently completed our Series A funding with a US-based investor (Canvas Ventures) we are building out the team for the next stage of the business.

You are:

Someone passionate about customer experience and driving revenue forward. You find delight in building relationships with industry-leading brands and helping them grow their business on eporta, whilst managing the needs of their clients on the platform. You’re able to work with a demanding client base and you have a strong commercial acumen.

Your role:

A unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high-performing team. Reporting into our Supplier Team Manager, you will be responsible of a set number of supplier accounts. While understanding their products, you will act as their representative on the platform to ensure that their sales are growing and their market reach expanding.

You will be working closely with the buyer team and their accounts to assist buyers on the platform; your aim is to get your brands the highest quote to order conversion rate possible while ensuring that buyers receive a great experience. 

You will liaise with your brands, buyers and our logistics partners to organise delivery of the orders you placed with the brands. It will be your responsibility to ensure that delivery is smooth and that any potential after-care is dealt with professionally.

You will build relationships with your brands through regular catch ups, showroom visits and training sessions showcasing their products. Working with the supplier team, you will make sure that all of the information about their products is up-to-date on the platform so that they can be promoted efficiently.

Your skills and experience: 
A genuine passion for delighting customers 
Excellent organisation skills
An innate ability to create trust and understand customer needs 
Great relationship management ability 
Strong commercial acumen and revenue creating drive 
2+ years in the furniture industry


Bonus points for... 
Existing relationship in the design industry  
Passion for design and interiors 
Previous work in a logistics role

If you are interested, please apply here : https://www.eporta.com/careers/brand-sales-operations-manager/

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are:

A fast-growing start-up revolutionising the design Industry, a market worth over $700bn annually. eporta is an online marketplace where architects, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting and accessories and purchase directly from suppliers.

We have users in over 80 countries, so our business is already truly global. We have a number of high profile investors including a large US venture capital fund, Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica.
We have recently completed our Series A funding with a US based investor (Canvas Ventures) and are building out the team for the next stage of the business.

Our technical team is growing; we use agile processes; we automate everything so we can focus on feature delivery, and we clean up behind ourselves to keep the codebase in excellent shape. Developers take responsibility for architecture, code, automated testing and peer reviews. We firmly believe in owning feature delivery from idea to production.

You are:

An experienced and enthusiastic developer with experience working on both the back and front end in an agile web environment. You are eager to continue building technical skills in a growing team whilst helping to shape the future and direction of a rapidly expanding platform and company.

- Self-motivated and passionate about building what’s right for the user
- Willing to take ownership of features - and contribute to making them superb
- Confident questioning and constructively critiquing the status-quo
- Keen to widen your skill set; organised and detail oriented.

Your role:

A unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high-performing team. Reporting to the VP Engineering, you will be working alongside the existing front-end & back-end engineers to deliver a well-architected, consistently high-quality system that will enable us to sustain our rapid growth.

You will mainly be working on our Python based back-end platform as well as expanding our React based frontend., Building new features and ensuring our architecture can scale to handle thousands of users across desktop and mobile. Work will be a combination of proofs-of-concept and investigation, large strategic projects, improving our internal tooling and some smaller tactical work. We work in small cross-functional product squads, so everything is up for grabs and we are always working on interesting projects.

Our stack:

Our main web app is built with Django on the back-end and React on the front. Our relational database is Postgres but we make heavy use of Elasticsearch for search and Redshift for data warehousing. We use Kinesis to underpin an event-based architecture for integrating with external systems and internal jobs. Our infrastructure is managed almost exclusively through CloudFormation, Ansible and AWS, with industry- standard cloud platforms for builds, testing and source code control.

Your skills and experience:

- Demonstrable experience of 4+ years commercial experience with Python or similar languages and front experience with React/Redux or similar frameworks
- Experience working in a cross functional agile team
- Experience designing & building APIs to drive client MVC sites & mobile apps
- Solid understanding of web technology & architecture
- Experience writing tests for both front and back end features
- Experience working with product designers and end-users to deliver features start to finish using Sketch, Zeplin, Jira (or similar)

Bonus points for...

- Knowledge of good dev-ops processes and experience of Ansible/ Puppet/ Chef
- Experience building scalable web-based systems
- Previous work in small, high-performance teams (especially web-based startups)

jobs.title: Sales Development Rep
jobs.description:
We are:
A fast-growing start-up revolutionising the design industry, a market worth over $700bn annually. eporta is an online marketplace where architects, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting and accessories, and purchase directly from suppliers.
 
With users in over 80 countries, our business is truly global, - and we will soon be expanding from our UK office into another European location, and then into the US. We have a number of high profile investors including a large US venture capital fund, Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica, and have just raised $8m in Series A funding.

We have ambitious growth targets for the business and the level of service we offer is absolutely central to our growth strategy. This involves handling brand accounts on their behalf and making sure both supplier and buyers get the best experience possible when selling and buying through us.
 
You are:
Someone who’s passionate about having a career in sales. You’re most comfortable on the phone and are able to build relationships quickly with people. You are naturally curious, constantly asking questions and finding information. You will be constantly on the lookout for new information/opportunities by being plugged into trade press and the industry. Your research skills are finely tuned, you are able to find, digest and communicate simply complex information and ideas. You’re ambitious and want to progress, driven by hitting numbers and being successful. Learning and developing is a key driver for you and you have a thirst to grow and progress. You’re comfortable with a fast paced environment, driving testing and change to ultimately do things better.
 
Your role:
This is a unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high performing team. You will be working closely with all the business development managers to ensure they are set up for success. You will be the first point of contact for all our new members, ensuring they are on-boarded and set up for success. You will be tasked with giving initial demos of the product. You will qualify and mine information to fully understand the opportunity presented and then create these as leads for the Business Development Manager to close. You will provide research support to the team so they are fully informed going into new opportunities.

Your skills and experience: 
- Organised and detail orientated
- Strong telephony skills
- Strong research skills
- Previous experience working in telephone sales
- Ability to manage your time effectively
 
Bonus points for... 
- Previous experience working in an interiors company
- Previous experience selling a product demo

Salary
• Base Salary: £25k - £30k
• OTE Salary: £35k - £40k
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are:
A fast-growing start-up revolutionising the design industry, a market worth over $700bn annually. eporta is an online marketplace where architects, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting and accessories, and purchase directly from suppliers.

With users in over 80 countries, our business is truly global, - and we will soon be expanding from our UK office into another European location, and then into the US. We have a number of high profile investors including a large US venture capital fund, Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica, and have just raised $8m in Series A funding.

We have ambitious growth targets for the business and the level of service we offer is absolutely central to our growth strategy. This involves handling brand accounts on their behalf and making sure both supplier and buyers get the best experience possible when selling and buying through us.
 
You are:
Someone who’s passionate about having a career in sales. You’re most comfortable on the phone and are able to build relationships quickly with people. You are naturally curious, constantly asking questions and finding information. You will be constantly on the lookout for new information/opportunities by being plugged into trade press and the industry. Your research skills are finely tuned, you are able to find, digest and communicate simply complex information and ideas. You’re ambitious and want to progress, driven by hitting numbers and being successful. Learning and developing is a key driver for you and you have a thirst to grow and progress. You’re comfortable with a fast paced environment, driving testing and change to ultimately do things better.
 
Your role:
This is a unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high performing team. You will be working closely with all the business development managers to ensure they are set up for success. You will be the first point of contact for all our new members, ensuring they are on-boarded and set up for success. You will be tasked with giving initial demos of the product. You will qualify and mine information to fully understand the opportunity presented and then create these as leads for the Business Development Manager to close. You will provide research support to the team so they are fully informed going into new opportunities.

Your skills and experience:

  • Organised and detail orientated
  • Strong telephony skills
  • Strong research skills
  • Previous experience working in telephone sales
  • Ability to manage your time effectively   Bonus points for...
  • Previous experience working in an interiors company
  • Previous experience selling a product demo

Salary
• Base Salary: £25k - £30k
• OTE Salary: £35k - £40k

We have ambitious growth targets for the business and the level of service we offer is absolutely central to our growth strategy. This involves handling brand accounts on their behalf and making sure both supplier and buyers get the best experience possible when selling and buying through us.
 
You are:
Someone who’s driven by building new relationships. You’re a natural networker, able to make connections and build new relationships within the industry. You’re passionate about being customer centric. You’re driven by solving problems and making things happen. You naturally go above & beyond to provide an amazing experience. You’re a self-starter who is able to motivate yourself to achieve goals. You are able to understand customer problems and are motivated to helping them solve them. You are constantly on the look out to up-sell and understand how you can further cement relationships. Your role:
This is a unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapid growth business whilst learning from our experienced and high performing team. You will be tasked with building relationships with these accounts, nurturing and growing them to continue to work with eporta. You will be their key point of contact, helping them navigate using eporta to deliver their projects.
 
Your skills and experience:
• A tenacious and dogged approach, ensuring no opportunity is left unturned
• At least 2 years previous Account Management/Customer Success experience
• Strong experience of building, growing and nurturing relationships
• Strong sales skills
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Strong written communication skills
• Compelling presentation style
• Ability to effectively manage your time across multiple priorities
• Strong problem solving skills and the ability to process complex
concepts  

Bonus points for...
• Experience working in the interiors industry
• Knowledge of how interior design projects work

Salary
• Base Salary: £25k - £30k
• OTE Salary: £50k+ with uncapped commission

jobs.title: Customer Support Agent
jobs.description:
We are:
eporta is a leading high-growth startup revolutionising the $700bn interior design Industry. An online sourcing and project management platform for interior designers and other businesses, so they have everything they need to deliver seamless design projects and grow their business. From inspiration and sourcing through to ordering and delivery, eporta allows you to manage everything all in one place. With users in over 80 countries, we are truly global.

With a number of high profile investors including Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) as well as the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com and Achica, we have recently completed our Series A funding with a US based investor (Canvas Ventures) we are building out the team for the next stage of the business.


You are:
Someone who is highly organised, proactive, ambitious and an all-round problem solver by nature. You love working as a team player, delivering best-in-class customer support that resolves complex problems swiftly and efficiently.

As a natural communicator, you are confident working with multiple stakeholders both internally and externally and across diverse ranges of customers. You take immense pride in creating amazing end-to-end customer experiences and are process driven.

Your role:
A unique opportunity to make a real impact in a rapidly growing business, while working alongside and learning from our experienced and high-performing team. Working closely across multiple functions in the business, you will be the go-to person for solving customer queries and supporting sales with pre-order items. Each day will present a new challenge; one minute you could be talking to a leading furniture brand in Scandinavia; the next, supporting an emerging interior designer around the corner in trendy Clerkenwell.

You will be the first point of contact for our customers, whether by phone, email or live chat. You'll be expected to communicate clearly and professionally with customers - and also with our internal teams - to resolve situations while navigating and prioritising multiple concurrent tasks. You’ll ensure customer support queries are handled quickly and efficiently, while being proactive in identifying opportunities that could be passed to the sales team.

With a keen eye for detail and a proactive mindset, you’ll provide valuable customer feedback to the product and customer experience teams. This role has been created for an ambitious, self-motivated individual who wants to make a significant difference in a fast growing startup.

Your skills and experience:

Excellent verbal communication and written skills.
Great relationship-building and relationship-management skills.
Proven ability to work independently and effectively manage your time.
First class organisational skills.
Take delight in providing best in class customer service.
A great problem solver.
Previous experience in a similar role, preferably for a startup.
Experiencing using support tools such as Hubspot Service Hub, Intercom, Aircall etc.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.

And for bonus points, demonstrate an interest for interior design or have previous experience in the industry.

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Executive (B2B)
jobs.description:
We are:
The leading high-growth startup revolutionising the $700bn a year interior design industry. As an online marketplace, interior designers and other businesses can discover high-design furniture, lighting, accessories and purchase directly from suppliers. With users in over 85 countries, the business is truly global.

We have a number of high profile investors including Guy Hands (founder of Terra Firma) and the founders of Zoopla, Betfair, sofa.com, and Achica. Having recently completed our Series A funding with a US-based investor (Canvas Ventures) we are building out the team for the next stage of the business.


You are:
Someone who is a creative thinker, full of ideas and enthusiasm. With strong organisation and time management skills, you are able to be proactive with the ability to execute on your own.

Comfortable working under pressure and at pace, you are a true growth hacker, able to leverage different tools and methods to achieve your objectives through ‘just working it out’. This means you have a strong desire to develop, learn and progress.

While being highly creative in your approach to problems, you are still highly analytical, with the ability to dive deep into the data to understand the performance of activity and develop actional next steps from them.


Your role:
As the Growth Marketing Executive, you will help drive top-of-funnel acquisition and execute optimisation across a variety of paid and organic activities. You will drive initiatives that focus on raising the awareness of eporta, creating effective nurturing programmes and driving acquisition. It’s a unique opportunity for an energetic, enthusiastic and focused self-starter who is ready to roll up their sleeves, get creative and make their mark in a fast-growing startup.

As the B2B marketplace for interior designers, this role is multifaceted. You will work across both digital and offline, with paid and organic channels. You will run both high volume marketing-led campaigns and support the business development team with assets.

You will be expected to be a problem solver, managing activities, being strong at analysis and reporting in order to make quickly but well informed decisions. Testing and learning quickly are key components of this role.



Responsibilities:

- Developing and implementing new growth marketing hacks (online and offline) to drive awareness and customer acquisition.
- Manage an activity calendar and analyse campaign performance to drive improvements where needed.
- Creating and managing highly targeted digital campaigns through Google, email, SEM, SEO, paid social, retargeting and influencer development to cultivate of word-of-mouth.
- Develop and create best practice content lead campaigns that deliver longtail SEO driven results.
- Creating lead generation and nurture campaigns for multiple customer segments.
- Build automated nurturing campaigns, analysing performance against key metrics.
- Support in website updates and the creation of landing pages to support lead generation activities.
- Assist with the organisation and delivery of events (hosted and participatory) - including all related marketing and communications.
- Manage internal stakeholders and external suppliers in order to achieve your goals.
- Use tools to effectively create landing pages, emails, events, automated nurturing, paid digital ad campaigns and anything else you need to execute your growth activity.
- Monitor & optimise performance of marketing activity, including but not limited to your specific activity.
- Support in tracking and reporting insight on competitor activities.



Your skills and experience

- 2+ years in growth or performance marketing
- Experience of B2B lead generation using various digital channels
- Proven analytical skills and the ability to optimise campaigns through insights
- Experience using top of the funnel marketing automation software such as Hubspot or Pardot
- Exceptional attention to detail
- Excellent analytical, communication and copywriting skills
- Ability to manage a busy workload and meeting tight deadlines.
- The creation of HTML emails using email marketing software
- Experience using design applications (e.g. Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite)
- Solid understanding of GDPR laws
- Proactive, flexible and ready to adapt to a fast-paced environment
- Experience in performance marketing tech stack, ideally including prior experience with Google Analytics, Hubspot and BI tools such as InsightSquared or Heap
- A bonus if you have worked or have an interest in the Interior Design industry
